repetitions.exitCondition: uncontrolled adverse events or dose adjustment
repetitions.sourceText: off-site phone visits every other cycle for subjects who have been receiving single-agent veliparib/placebo at a stable dose without adjustment for multiple cycles without uncontrolled adverse events
Update tumor assessment schedule from every 9 weeks
allow every 12 weeks (or at longer intervals not to exceed 24 weeks per the investigator's discretion) from the prior scan
remove the requirement of tumor assessment at Final Visit in subjects without a tumor assessment within 4 weeks

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'If subject discontinues carboplatin and paclitaxel without progression', 'path': ['VELIPARIB_PLACEBO_MONOTHERAPY']}, {'condition': 'If subject randomized to placebo experiences PD', 'path': ['UNBLINDING', 'CROSSOVER_OPEN_LABEL_VELIPARIB_MONOTHERAPY']}, {'condition': 'If subject discontinues therapy for reasons other than progression', 'path': ['ON_STUDY_OFF_DRUG_MONITORING', 'SURVIVAL_FOLLOW_UP']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Scheduled to occur every other cycle for subjects receiving single-agent veliparib/placebo.
Scheduled at regular intervals (every 9 to 12 weeks, not to exceed 24 weeks) to monitor disease control.
Conditional workflow triggered only after disease progression to determine eligibility for open-label veliparib.
Used as a decision point to determine when chemotherapy can begin based on specific blood count guidelines.
Standardized repeated monitoring for all subjects who have discontinued therapy.
A one-time data analysis event that occurred on 03 June 2019, triggering changes in study conduct.
Continuous monitoring and reporting required over a specific time period due to potential delayed onset.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: min(Date of disease progression, Date of death) - Date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant hazard ratio (target 0.69) using log-rank test
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Progression-free Survival (PFS): will be defined as the number of days from the date the subject is randomized to the date the subject experiences disease progression per RECIST (version 1.1) and surv

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Overall Survival (OS)

timeWindow.duration: Until death, lost to follow-up, or study termination

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Date of death - Date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Overall Survival (OS): will be evaluated according to survival information and post treatment information... until the endpoint of death, the subject is lost to follow-up or until the study terminatio

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
inputs: Number of subjects with Complete Response (CR)
Number of subjects with Partial Response (PR)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Subjects with CR + Subjects with PR) / Total subjects
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Objective Response Rate (ORR)... will be evaluated according to progression per RECIST (version 1.1).

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR)
inputs: Number of subjects with Stable Disease (SD) >= 6 months
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Subjects with CR + PR + SD) / Total subjects
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Clinical benefit rate (CBR)... will be evaluated according to progression per RECIST (version 1.1).

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: PFS2
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: min(Date of second progression, Date of death) - Date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: PFS2: will be evaluated according to survival information and post treatment information (includes dates of therapy and response per RECIST 1.1) collected at two-month intervals.

derivedVariables.name: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the date of randomization to the date of earliest objective disease progression (per RECIST 1.1) or death from any cause.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Continuous from randomization until event or censoring
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at the date of the last valid tumor assessment for subjects without an event

derivedVariables.name: Overall Survival (OS)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause.
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at the date the subject was last known to be alive

derivedVariables.name: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Proportion of subjects with a best overall response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) for a specified minimum duration.
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Non-responder for subjects with missing assessments

derivedVariables.name: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Proportion of subjects with a best overall response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR).
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Non-responder for subjects with missing assessments

derivedVariables.name: PFS2
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the date of randomization to the date of second objective disease progression or death.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Continuous from randomization until second event
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at last known date without second progression

derivedVariables.name: Duration of Response (DOR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the date of first documented response (CR or PR) to the date of earliest objective disease progression or death.
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at the date of the last valid tumor assessment

derivedVariables.name: Change in ECOG Performance Status
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Post-baseline ECOG score - Baseline ECOG score
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value before or on Day 1

derivedVariables.name: Change in QoL Indices
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Post-baseline QoL score - Baseline QoL score
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value before or on Day 1

Subjects should have a brain MRI within 28 days of randomization to confirm the absence of CNS metastases. Contrast CT is acceptable for subjects who are unable to undergo a brain MRI. !
